sent1: Once a renowned artist favored by top dealers , he was banned from exhibiting after the war , his work deemed unacceptable , despite past success and demand .
sent2: Before the war , Beckmann had been at the peak of his career . He was a prominent figure in Berlin’s art scene and widely admired for his skill as a draftsman and painter , for his self - confidence , and for his charismatic personality . His works were included in all the major exhibitions of modern art throughout Europe . But after Hitler came to power , Beckmann was branded a " degenerate artist . ” He was fired from his job teaching at the Frankfurt Städel School . And he was forbidden to paint or exhibit his work .

sent2: Salman Rushdie , the Booker Prize - winning author of " Midnight 's Children , " will write a memoir about the stabbing attack he suffered in 1989 . The book is scheduled for publication in September by Random House .

sent1: Cold , wet visit to a Fraser Valley Christmas tree farm : saw trees grown , shaped , harvested , and picked our own to take home .
sent2: A few years ago , my husband and I were shopping for a Christmas tree at the local Home Depot . After we paid for it , the cashier asked if we wanted to donate money to support the planting of more trees . We gave her our money , but then realized that there was no need to plant new trees—all she needed to do was take our tree back outside . Our tree could have been replanted and grown again !

sent1: Justice Thomas did n't disclose loan terms to Senate Judiciary Committee ; he claimed no discussions with wife or others ; failure violated federal law .
sent2: The terms of the loan were not disclosed when Justice Thomas filled out financial forms for his Supreme Court confirmation hearings in 1991 . The senators who reviewed the documents said that if they had known about the loan , they might have voted differently on whether to confirm him .

sent1: A flawed documentary on Lily , an Asian - American woman adopted by a white family , navigating Chinese , American , and adopted identities—none fully realized .
sent2: " The Sweet East , ” a new play by Stephen Metcalfe , is set in a time and place that are no longer with us . It was the late 1960 s , when the world was still ruled by men who wore suits to work and didn’t leave their wives for younger women . It was also a time of relative innocence ; one character describes it as " a sweet east wind that blew across America . ” That wind has now changed into something darker and more destructive — an ill wind that blows nobody any good . sent1: Kelton Reid interviews Jennifer Miller on researching family history for * Inheriting the Holy Land * , sharing respectful , dignified memoir - writing tips . Listen now !
sent2: In the most recent issue of Wired magazine ( March 2015 ) , there is an article by Mat Honan entitled , " Love Letter : When Google Search Reveals Too Much " . It 's a great read about how our lives are revealed through search results . I encourage you to check it out . The article focuses on how a Google search for his name reveals a lot of personal information about him . It 's not necessarily bad stuff - just stuff that he would prefer be private and confidential .

sent1: In " Oppenheimer , " Emily Blunt portrays an idealistic doctor treating Manhattan Project scientists , disillusioned as she learns bombs were tested , not just used to end WWII .

sent1: Astrid Delgado wrote her UT Austin essay about her parents ' move from Puerto Rico to Brooklyn , struggling in poverty , while her father worked long hours , leaving her to care for her brother .
sent2: Astrid Delgado first learned that she might have to work harder than her white classmates when she was in middle school and took an exam for a private high school . When the results came back , her father was upset to learn that his daughter had scored 90 percent or higher on all but one part of the test — where she got only 51 percent . The section asked students to choose words from a list that best described themselves . Ms. Delgado , who is now 23 , said she chose " shy” because it seemed like the right answer . But her father , who was born in Mexico , thought otherwise . " My dad told me I should have put ‘Latina , ’” she said . " I didn’t think about my race . ” In time , though , the
